chargeHist.descr: Sexual Intercourse with Child 16 or Older, Actor 19 or Older

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

authorizing court-appointed defense investigator signed by the Court 10.13.22
IT IS HEREBY ORDERED that the defense is authorized to hire, at county expense, Charles Hess of CMC Investigations for the purpose of conducting investigation on behalf of the defendant in this case. Such expense shall not exceed $625.00, which is the equivalent of 25 hours of work by Charles Hess, plus expenses, without prior approval of the Court.

2:17 PM Defendant Jaime Lopez in court, in custody.  Attorney William Andrew Mayer in court for Jaime Lopez.  Prosecuting attorney Rebecca Meyer in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Detective Brandon Kehoe, sworn & testified - D, X

Court finds Probable Cause/Deft bound over.
Information filed/reading waived. NG pleas entered on all Counts.
950/Marsy's Law complied with.

State objects to any modification of bond.
Court will not modify bond and denies Defense motion.
